graph.properties.splitting

Class Splitting<V extends Vertex,E extends Edge<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.properties.splitting.Splitting<V,E>

  • public class Splitting<V extends Vertex,E extends Edge<V>>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Splitting() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<V> findAllCutVertices(Graph<V,E> graph)
      A cut vertex is a vertex whose removal would disconnect the remaining graph
      java.util.List<SplitPair<V,E>> findAllSeparationPairs(Graph<V,E> graph)
      A pair of vertices {x,y} of a 2-connected graph is a separation pair if there exists two subgraphs G1' = (v1, E1') and G2' = (V2, E2') which satisfy the following conditions V = V1 U v2 V1 ∩ V2 = {x,y} E = E1' U E2' E1' ∩ E2' = O |E1'| >= 2 |E2'| >= 2
      java.util.List<SplitComponent<V,E>> findAllSplitComponents(Graph<V,E> graph, SplitPair<V,E> splitPair) 
      java.util.List<SplitPair<V,E>> findAllSplitPairs(Graph<V,E> graph)
      A pair {u,v} of vertices is a split pair if it is an edge in the graph or if it is a separation pair (it increases the number of connected components) in the graph (graph is no longer connected if it is removed)
      java.util.List<SplitPair<V,E>> maximalSplitPairs(Graph<V,E> graph, E edge)
      A maximal split pair with respect to some edge is a split pair not dominated by any other split pair with respect to that edge There may several such pairs
      Graph<V,E> splitGraph(java.util.List<SplitComponent<V,E>> splitComponents, E edge)
      A split graph of a split pair with respect of some edge is the union of all split components which don't contain that edge
      Graph<V,E> splitGraph(SplitPair<V,E> splitPair, E edge, Graph<V,E> graph) 
      boolean splitPairIsDominantedBy(Graph<V,E> graph, SplitPair<V,E> dominanted, SplitPair<V,E> dominant, E edge)
      A split pair {u,v} is dominated by another split pair {x,y} if
      boolean testSplitComponents(java.util.List<SplitComponent<V,E>> components, SplitPair<V,E> splitPair)
      All components should have two vertices in common: split pair vertices and no edges

      • findAllSeparationPairs

        public java.util.List<SplitPair<V,E>> findAllSeparationPairs(Graph<V,E> graph)
        A pair of vertices {x,y} of a 2-connected graph is a separation pair if there exists two subgraphs G1' = (v1, E1') and G2' = (V2, E2') which satisfy the following conditions V = V1 U v2 V1 ∩ V2 = {x,y} E = E1' U E2' E1' ∩ E2' = O |E1'| >= 2 |E2'| >= 2
